properties.address: Central Methodist Church, Chesterfield, Derbyshire S40 1UH
properties.description: Our Warm Space will be open every Friday, beginning 3rd November 2023 until the end of March 2024, from 3.00pm - 6.00pm. We provide a warm and friendly welcome to all, with hot drinks, a warm meal, friendship, time to chat, support and signposting to other agencies to help if required. Direct access from the street. All areas, including toilets, are wheelchair accessible. Facilities for babies and young children, including baby change area. TV screen for showing films, play video games, not mainstream TV. Cornerstone Christian Bookshop and Coffee Shop is also open every day, except Wednesday, and Sunday 10:00 - 15:00.
properties.title: Cornerstone, Central Methodist Church, Chesterfield, Derbyshire S40 1UH

properties.address: Greenaway Workshop, Derbyshire DE4 2PT
properties.description: Open and accessible warm and inviting space .Our evolving wellbeing hub in Darley Dale provides a variety of activities to support the local community. Activities include arts and crafts, furniture restoration, mental health courses, our allotment-based gardening sessions, and walking groups. Our Friday Coffee and Chat sessions also provide help with accessing services

properties.description: Open since 2016, Monkey Park is a community hub where all are welcome. We have a community cafe, an office co-working space and a cycle refurbishment workshop. Each of these spaces houses its own little community who are welcoming to all. We also run support services for our local community. There is a pay it forward scheme so that those who are currently short of funds can get food & drink for free.

hours._text: Chesterfield Baptist Church, Cross Street, Chesterfield, Derbyshire, S40 4ST Wednesdays, 10am to 4pm - Renew Wellbeing Café Hot drinks, cakes and soup. Craft, jigsaws, board games, quiet space or bring your own hobby. Once a month on Saturdays 9.30am to 11am - ‘Who Let the Dads Out’ Activities for pre-schoolers, infants and Dads. Drinks and food are available. First Sunday of month 6pm to 7.30pm - Waste Not Café Cooking up surplus food donated by supermarkets into a three-course vegetarian and vegan meal. Rev. Steve Barnwell 07939 103079 / 01246 221105 www.chesterfieldbaptistchurch.org revstevecbc@gmail.com

Chesterfield Library, New Beetwell St, Chesterfield, S40 1QN The library is a warm and welcoming place to go. It can’t offer the same facilities as a ‘Warm Space’ venue but it is a place people can go to get warm and be signposted to sources of information and support if they need it.

Central Methodist Church, Saltergate, Chesterfield, S40 1UH Fridays, 3pm to 6pm, Cornerstone coffee bar area. Free drinks and food, with board games, screen available to show family-friendly films and Xbox games. Angela Walker
New Street Centre, New St, Chesterfield, S40 2JZ Chesterfield Community Church Tuesdays from 10.30am until 4pm. Free lunch from 12.30pm, refreshments all day. Mr Tom Parker, 07769 9535524
Derby Road, Methodist Church, 22 Jawbones Hill, Chesterfield, S40 2EN Fridays, 1pm to 4pm. A free warm space, offering light refreshments after school hours. Jonathan Hood 07707 045510

Grace Chapel, 89 New Square, Chesterfield, S40 1PH Mondays, 10.30am to 12.30pm – Warm space, tea, coffee, biscuits and a natter. Wednesdays, 10.30am to 1pm – as above plus wellbeing forum. Arts, crafts and board games (for example, chess). Friday, 10.30am to 1pm – Warm space, tea, coffee, biscuits and singing. Sunday, 12.30pm to 2.30pm – Feeding for the homeless and showers. Pastor Toyin Taiwo 07593 331294

Gussies Kitchen, St Augustine’s Church 220 Derby Rd, Chesterfield, S40 2EP Tuesdays and Wednesdays 8.30am to 4pm A free warm space offering hot and cold drinks, food, activities and advice. Rev Sally-Anne 07307 201718 Lisa Blakemore 07805 084376 Jacob Glaister 07310 715213

Hasland Club Hampton Street, Hasland, Chesterfield, S41 0LH Tuesday and Wednesday evening's 6pm to 8pm. Warm space, free hot drinks, biscuits, snacks and table games. Andrew Mallender Chair Friends of Hasland Community Hub

Holme Hall Unite Community Hub, 41 Mercaston Close, Holme Hall, Chesterfield, S40 4UE Tuesdays and Fridays between 12.30pm and 5pm A free warm space offering drinks. Other services include a book and DVD library, activities such as crafts etc, social interaction, and advice and support. Tony Hedley 07547 757670 tonyhedley@gmail.com

Loundsley Green Methodist Church, 40 Pennine Way, Chesterfield, S40 4NF Starting 2 November - Wednesday 10am to 12.30pm A free warm space called ‘Welcome Wednesdays’ offering hot drinks, toast, biscuits. There are also activities such as card making, and knitting. We can offer a quiet space to read. Toys will be available for babies / toddlers. There will also be give-aways such as knitted gloves and hats. Rev Tracey Harris tracey.harris@methodist.org.uk 01246 274481

Loundsley Green Community Centre, Cuttholme Rd, Loundsley Green, Chesterfield S40 4QU Tuesdays between 10am and 1pm A free warm space offering hot drinks, biscuits and soup. There are also activities such as games and cards, and toys / books are available for children. We also offer a quiet space for anyone who may want to talk if they are feeling anxious, worried, on a one-to-one basis. We have a trained Mental Health First Aider available. Gill Carlile 2duckies@googlemail.com 07521 353467

Monkey Park Community Hub, 128a Chester Street, Brampton, Chesterfield Wednesday to Saturday, 10am to 4pm The Community Hub provides friendship and purpose. It is open to all, with ‘pay-it-forward’ free drinks, food or affordable refreshments to buy. There is also wifi available, a book swap, lots of activities and clubs. People are welcome to stay all day. Valerie Wilkinson and Simon Redding info@MonkeyPark.org.uk

St Thomas Church, Chatsworth Road, Chesterfield, S40 3AW St Thomas’ welcomes people to attend the centre to get warm whilst its activities are running. It's free to enter and you don’t have to be involved in any of the activities (although if you do and you’re struggling financially, there will be no charge for the activities). Tots group for babies, toddlers and pre-schoolers and their grown ups. Songs, Bible stories, sensory activities. Socialising for children and adults. Hot drink and biscuit included for adults. £1 per session. Kids club for children in Reception-Year 6. Friends, games, Bible, fun. £1 per session. Knit and Natter is a friendly group of people who enjoy crafts. £3.50 per session which includes refreshments. Golden Folks is an over 60’s group. There is usually a speaker or an activity. £5 per session which includes tea/coffee and cake. For men of all ages. For some meetings we take a trip out to a nearby place of interest. The cost of these visits depends on the admission price at the venue. Alternatively we meet at 1pm in the Church Centre to listen to a guest speaker – the cost then is £3 per person. Talks range over a wide variety of topics. St Thomas, Brampton church office 01246 558461 contact@stthomasbrampton.com

Storrs Road Methodist Church, Upper Moor Street, Brampton, Chesterfield, S40 3NR Starting 8 November - Tuesdays (except for first Tuesday of each month), 9am to 12pm A free warm space / community coffee morning with refreshments. There are also activities such as jigsaw puzzles and board games, and toys are available for pre-school children. We also run a book exchange. Rev Tracey Harris tracey.harris@methodist.org.uk 01246 274481

The DVA Hub @ Low Pavement, 61-63 Low Pavement, Chesterfield, S40 1PA Monday to Thursday, 11am to 3pm A free warm space offering hot drinks and biscuits. - reading - card making - photography - gaming - art - sing-a-long - crochet - fabric crafts - skill swap - tech-buddies Refreshments are provided. James Starky 07743 514934 01246 555908 James@dva,org,uk

- Hasland Community Hub The Derbyshire Unemployed Workers Centre will be running in the hall (benefits advice and support completing forms) Philip Arrandale Grassland Hasmore Big Local - Let’s Chat Project Residents are invited to come along and meet new people, use the internet and access support around things like benefits advice and completing online forms. The project offers a free warm space with free laptop use, board games available and hot drinks. Chris Newton 07825183569

The Hub, Chesterfield FC Technique Stadium, Sheffield Road, Chesterfield, S41 8NZ Open until 17 February. Monday to Friday, 5pm to 7.30pm. The Hub café offers warmth, TV, company, tea, coffee, biscuits, fruit and board games. There are opportunities for the whole family to access the facilities and services provided at The Hub – including play centre, soccer school, craft, multi-sport, dance, roller disco, weight management programmes and signposting to other support agencies. Jayne Bacon jaynebacon@spireitestrust.org.uk

properties.title: The Hub Chesterfield FC Technique Stadium

hours._text: Umbrellas Cosy Hub, Burns Close, Chesterfield, S40 2SW Monday and Tuesday 10am to 3pm Friday 12pm to 3pm. (Cosy Cubs toddlers, 10am to 11am) Offering an activity programme throughout the week which visitors are welcome to join in (apart from toddlers’ session). Drinks and biscuits on offer to all visitors. Monday – no activities, but the space is open to all. Tuesday morning – crafts Tuesday afternoon – games and bingo Friday afternoon – Cosy Cubs toddlers Eric Nicholas Enicholas1964@gmail.com 07950 735635

Walton Evangelical Church, Moorland View Rd, Chesterfield, S40 3DD Soup, rolls and hot drinks available. This is a free event for all the community. Join weekly on Wednesday afternoons. Phone 01246 231002 Email office@waltonchurch.org More details can be found at waltonchurch.org/warmer

Holy Trinity Church & Christ Church Newbold Road Chesterfield S41 7PG Come and have a brew, meet new friends or help us mash the tea. An opportunity to share stories and have breakfast together. A warm welcome to everybody. Rev Jill Hancock CA 01246 465659 / 07746668257

Church from the Bus, the rear entrance of Grace Chapel, off Rose Hill Church on the bus serves vulnerable people who live in Chesterfield. We provide warmth, shelter, food and drinks, clothing, prayer and a listening ear to anyone in need. Ian Macleod 07368 331219

Sorbo Lounge, 1 Market Place, Chesterfield, S40 1TW Monday to Sunday, 9am to 11pm. Come in and sit for as long as you want, no purchase necessary. Free tea or coffee. Everyone is always welcome here. 01246 235845

Chesterfield Studios Rose Hill Chesterfield S40 1LW Tuesdays, 10.30am to 12.30am A free and welcoming warm space for those who need it. Free refreshments will be provided along with small independent activities. If you want to bring along something you enjoy doing or if you just fancy a natter and some company, that’s fine too! Contact Becky Parker or Wendy Barnett on 07598 826982
Newbold Parish Church (in the room behind the church) St John’s Road Newbold Chesterfield S41 8PE Mondays, 12pm to 3.30pm. Rev Rhoda, 07787 980961
St Mark's Church St Mark's Road Brampton Chesterfield S40 1DH Wednesdays, 8.45am to 10am Free tea, coffee and toast and toys for little ones. A warm welcome awaits everyone. 01246 913682
